item.title: New Location in Downtown Charlottesville
item.description: The new office is ready for students!

item.title: New Location in Downtown Charlottesville
item.description: New Downtown Location Starting in September, Blue Ridge Boost is located at 222 Court Square, Charlottesville. To reach us, please walk around to the back of the building. Walk up the stairs to the second floor and enter through the door on your left. The closest paid parking is the Market Street Garage. Free 2-hour parking is available throughout the Downtown area.

item.title: Fall Classes
item.description: Fall classes coming soon!

item.title: Algebra 2 Tutoring in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: We help your child succeed in algebra and teach advanced concepts to students that are ready for a challenging curriculum. Our services include an Algebra 1 review before school starts, ongoing support with classroom content, and new topics and lessons. Get Ready for Algebra 2! Join our summer classes in August, to participate in a carefully developed curriculum to review Algebra 1, including linear functions, linear equations and systems of equations, exponent laws, quadratic functions, and polynomials.

item.title: Algebra Tutoring in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: We help your child succeed in algebra and teach advanced concepts to students that are ready for a challenging curriculum. Our services include a prealgebra review before school starts, ongoing support with classroom content, and new topics and lessons. Get Ready for Algebra 1! Join our summer classes in August to participate in a carefully developed curriculum to review pre-algebra, including fractions, ratios, proportions, order of operations, and exponents. To secure your spot in one of our review sessions signup here!

item.title: AMC and MathCounts Coaching in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: AMC Coach and Tutor in Charlottesville An experienced instructor with MathCounts and AMC8 coaching experience teaches mini-lessons on topics commonly found in competition math problems and leads students in solving practice problems. The content of the class depends on the target competition and the student’s background. Don’t hesitate to get in touch with us for further information. For more details on our services, fill out the contact form or email nora@blueridgeboost.

item.title: AP® Calculus AB/BC Tutoring in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Get Ready for AP® Calculus AB/BC! Join our summer classes in August to participate in a carefully developed curriculum to review linear, quadratic, polynomial, exponential, and trigonometric functions. To secure your spot in one of our review sessions signup here! AP® Calculus AB/BC Private Tutor Contact us to set up lessons and problem-solving sessions for AP® Calculus AB/BC! Click here to book a tutoring session.

item.title: AP® Statistics Tutoring in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description:
Get Ready for AP® Statistics! Join our summer classes in August to participate in a carefully developed curriculum to review probabilities, statistics, and linear, quadratic, and exponential functions. To secure your spot in one of our review sessions signup here! A®P Statistics Private Tutoring Contact us to set up lessons and problem-solving sessions for AP® Statistics! item.title: Authors | Blue Ridge Boost
Block Language Classes for Six to Ten-Year-Olds | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Students ages six to ten learn fundamental coding concepts by helping a beaver build a dam on instructor-provided Chromebooks. First, students learn to code using simple commands to move left, right and drop logs. Next, students learn to code repetition using repeat loops executed a fixed or a variable number of times. In the second part of the course, students learn to code using conditional loops. In the third part of the course, students learn to code using conditional statements with simple and compound conditions.

item.title: Coding and Computer Science Tutor | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Free trial coding classes every Saturday at 10 am and every Sunday at 4:30 pm. -- Sign up for a free trial coding class, book a private tutoring session or email nora@blueridgeboost.com to join or request a class! Coding Classes Preschool Coding Block Languages using Code Monkey Robotics with Lego WeDo 2.0® Scratch Robotics with Lego Spike® Coffee Script using Code Monkey® Python Programming Coding Tutor AP® Computer Science Principles (Python) AP®Computer Science (Java) USA Computing Olympiad Bronze College-Level Courses-- CS 1110 Introduction to Programming CS 2100 Data Structures and Algorithms 1 CS 2120 Discrete Mathematics and Theory 1 CS 3120 Discrete Mathematics and Theory 2 CS 3100 Data Structures and Algorithms 2 CS 3140 Software Development Essentials CS 3240 Advanced Software Development Techniques CS 3250 Software Testing CS 3710 Introduction to Cybersecurity CS 4620 Compilers CS 4630 Defense Against the Dark Arts CS 4750 Database Systems

item.title: Coding Classes in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Kindergarten to Second Grade Block Coding Times by request Scratch Sundays, 1:00 – 1:50 pm Sundays, 2:00 – 2:50 pm Third to Fifth Grade Coffee Script Sundays, 11:00 – 11:50 am Sundays, 3:30 – 4:30 pm Other times by request Sixth to Eight Grade Python Saturdays, 2:30 – 3:20 pm Sundays, 12:00 — 12:50 pm Other times by request

item.title: Coding Group Classes for 4 to 6 year olds | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Our youngest students learn fundamental coding concepts by helping a monkey collect bananas on instructor-provided Chromebooks. Students learn the basics of coding using left, right, jump up, jump left, and jump right commands to guide a monkey to collect all bananas before opening a treasure chest. In addition, students learn to code repetition by using loops and conditional loops. The course concludes with procedures. The classes run in four-week sessions. Each class is 30 minutes long.

item.title: Competition Math for Elementary and Middle School | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: An experienced instructor teaches mini-lessons on topics commonly found in Math Olympiad contests and leads students in solving practice problems. The content of the class depends on the target competition and the student’s background. Don’t hesitate to get in touch with us for further information. To secure your spot in one of our review sessions signup here! Click here to book a tutoring session.

item.title: Contact | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Don’t hesitate to get in touch with us for any learning needs in math and computing. We offer online and in-person one-on-one instruction and in-person group classes for students from middle school to graduate student level in Mathematics and Computer Science.

item.title: Geometry Tutoring in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: We help your child succeed in algebra and teach advanced concepts to students that are ready for a challenging curriculum. Our services include algebra and middle school geometry review before school starts, ongoing support with classroom content, and new topics and lessons. Get Ready for Geometry Join our Summer classes in August to participate in a carefully developed curriculum to review Algebra 1 topics, including linear equations, systems of linear equations, and the Pythagorean Theorem.

item.title: Individualized Math Tutoring | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Free trial coding classes every Saturday at 10 am and every Sunday at 4:30 pm. -- Book a private tutoring session or email nora@blueridgeboost.com to set up a free evaluation! Elementary Math Counts -- Elementary Math Math Olympiad Coaching Middle School Middle School Math Algebra 1 Geometry AMC 8/10/12 Coaching -- High School Algebra 2 Pre-calculus AP® Calculus AB/BC AP® Statistics College Calculus Abstract Algebra Real Analysis General Topology --

item.title: Kids Classes in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Students learn fundamental coding concepts using Coffee Script, a beginner-friendly text-based coding language. The young coders use an attractive graphical interface to generate text by pressing buttons on instructor-provided Chromebooks. Some previous experience typing is helpful but not necessary. Classes run in four-week sessions. Each class is 50 minutes long. We adjust classes to the pace of each student. Students typically need between ten to fourteen sessions to complete the course, depending on age and previous coding experience.

item.title: Lego® Robotics for Children in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Come and learn to build and program Lego® robots! In each lesson, students build a Lego® robot using a design model, improve and extend it, and then create a program using Scratch to control and move the robot. The robots use a medium power motor to act, depth, and tilt sensor to sense. A Scratch program encodes the robot’s actions in response to sensing. Sign up here for a free trial coding class!

item.title: Lego® Spike Robotics for Children in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Come and learn to build and program Lego® robots! Students learn to build robot attachments and code the Lego Spike® robot using Scratch. Sign up here for a free trial coding class!

item.title: Math and Coding Camps in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Morning Camps Ages 6 to 10: Come to learn to code using Scratch or Coffee Script, build Lego® robots and solve math puzzles! The activities do not repeat; students may join us for one, two, or all three weeks! Session 1: 9 am to 1 pm, July 24th to July 28th Session 2: 9 am to 1 pm, July 31st to August 4th Session 3: 9 am to 1 pm, August 7th to August 11th

item.title: Math Tutoring for Children in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: At Blue Ridge Boost, we teach problem-solving skills using a variety of math manipulatives, Montessori materials, and math games. In addition, we use a variety of curricula based on the Virginia Standards of Learning, Common Core, Singapore Math®, and Beast Academy®. Experienced instructors are ready to help your child develop a good understanding of the content, whether to keep up with classwork or expand knowledge beyond the school curriculum. For more details on our services, fill out the contact form or email nora@blueridgeboost.

item.title: Middle School Math Tutoring in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: We help your child succeed in math and teach advanced concepts to students that are ready for a challenging curriculum. At Blue Ridge Boost, a qualified and experienced teacher assesses your student’s knowledge and builds an individualized instruction plan that targets weak areas while assisting with topics the student is learning. For more details on our services, fill out the contact form or email nora@blueridgeboost.com. Click here to book a tutoring session.

item.title: Precalc Tutoring in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: We help your child succeed in precalculus and teach advanced concepts to students that are ready for a challenging curriculum. Our services include an Algebra 2 review before school starts, ongoing support with classroom content, and new topics and lessons. Get Ready for Math Analysis/Precalc! Join our summer classes in August to participate in a carefully developed curriculum to review Algebra 2 and Trigonometry, including quadratic, exponential, polynomial, and trigonometric functions.

item.title: Python Classes in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Are you a middle schooler interested in Python? Come and learn with us! Students learn Python using a combination of lessons that use the Code Monkey platform and Jupyter Notebooks created by the instructor. Classes run in four-week sessions. Each class is 50 minutes long. We adjust classes to the pace of each student. Students typically need between ten to fourteen sessions to complete the course, depending on age and previous coding experience.

item.title: Scratch Coding for Children in Charlottesville | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Learn Scratch with us! We teach Scratch using a project-based approach. You will learn to create games, including Make it Fly!, Dungeons, Pong, Dodge the Balls, Jumping game, Math facts practice, a clone of Crossy Road, and much more. Sign up here for a free trial coding class!

item.title: USA Computing Olympiad Coaching | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: Contact us to get coaching for USA Computing Olympiad! Click here to book a tutoring session.

item.title: Vision and History | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: During the COVID-19 pandemic, I spent a significant amount of time teaching and helping my children learn and discovered that I greatly enjoy teaching young students. As a result, I quit my Ph.D. program in Computer Science to pursue a degree in teaching at the University of Virginia and launched Blue Ridge Boost. During the lockdown, Maxwell and Dorina tried a variety of challenging and exciting classes from the Center for Talented Youth at John Hopkins and The Art Of Problem Solving.

item.title: Your Instructor: Nora Evans | Blue Ridge Boost
item.description: I am originally from Bucharest, Romania and earned a B.S. in Computer Science at the Polytechnical University of Bucharest. I moved to Charlottesville in the Fall of 2004 to pursue graduate school at the University of Virginia, where I earned a Master’s in Computer Science, a Master of Science in Mathematics, and a Master of Teaching. I have several years of experience as a software engineer and am the author of several research papers in Computer Science.
